channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 67c Glengall Road, 15th June
item.description:
5-6 black bin bags of garden waste. Dumped by 66A Glengall Road after they cleaned out their garden .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Cobbled pavement near Boots the chemist, 15th June
item.description:
The cobbles are very uneven and I tripped and fell flat on my face. My face was bleeding and my glasses were broken.Two of your street officers came to help me and were very good. They wanted to get an ambulance but I just wanted to go home. When I got home I was in a lot of pain from my ribs. I went to hospital and had an x-ray but luckily nothing was broken only badly bruised I tried to upload photos but there is something wrong with your website
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 150, Camden High Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Man throwing fast food rubbish outside car window., 15th June
item.description:
Asian man sitting in his car throwing rubbish outside the window all over the street in front the off licence next to the thai restaurant. He was waiting for someone in there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin not being emptied, 15th June
item.description:
The council litter bin in Newington Gardens Dog Area has not been emptied for several weeks. It’s becoming a real problem. It seems like it has been left off the collection schedule somehow as other bins are being emptied. Thanks in advance for your help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swan Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van parked in my bay, 15th June
item.description:
A van has been parked in my allocated bay since November last year. I have reported this multiple times to both PCM (Parking Control Management) and MTVH (Metropolitan Thames Valley Housing Association), but no action has been taken.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London

item.title: Overflowing bin and bags of litter, 15th June
item.description:
An overflowing bin has been left in the road after bin collection day. There are also several sacks of rubbish all over the street. Street hasn’t been cleaned for at least a week. Our black bin is missing - I believe it’s this one but it’s not our rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ritson Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned wrecked car, 15th June
item.description:
Been here a couple of weeks now. It's illegally parked as you can see. Has caused a couple of very close calls. Since the council have been made aware and are yet to act, there's a good chance you'd be partly liable. People were joking about burning it the other day. You need to remove it asap. Seriously. All the neighbours are fed up with it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Lane, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
